website_summaries.verdict: The Life Walker Strap from Propet was highly praised by people looking for a comfortable and supportive walking companion. Its ability to alleviate pain was also greatly appreciated by users with various foot conditions.
pros: A vast majority of owners were delighted that the Propet Life Walker Strap was not only comfortable for extended periods of walking and standing, but also alleviated foot, leg, and back pain brought about by age or health issues
A high number of consumers stated that the style of the trainer paired well with both casual and formal wear
The upper provided adequate lateral support and ankle hold, according to droves of wearers
A myriad of reviewers liked the strap closure as it allowed them to put on and remove the merchandise quickly
The product was reasonably priced, considering its quality build, said numerous buyers
Plenty of users enjoyed the lightweight nature of the footwear
Multiple testers appreciated that this model accommodated the use of custom orthotics and ankle-foot orthosis braces
The arch support provided stability, as reported by a lot of purchasers
More than a few people commended the outsole because it did not leave streaks on polished floors and provided traction even on smooth surfaces
The upper was deemed breathable and kept the feet fresh, as stated by several individuals
cons: Those with high insteps complained about the closure mechanism
the tongue was too narrow to cover the instep and the straps were too short to secure the foot
A few commenters mentioned quality issues such as the leather chipping off, stitches unraveling, and the Velcro detaching from the strap after a few months of regular use
Some folks noted that the style could be updated and wished that the footgear was available in tan or brown color options

customer_reviews.title: Continued mobility.
customer_reviews.text: With limited mobility, and severe disability to my legs and feet I cannot wear standard shoes. I have been wearing the life walker strap shoes for over 5 years now, and they are the only shoe that I can wear in relative comfort. Their wide size, and padded interior allow me to walk for at least moderate to short distances, and stand for at least short periods of time. For me these shoes mean freedom from the constraints of an electric wheel chair. Thank you Propet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward N. Ryan Jr.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My husband loved them!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband while we were visiting our son (blind ordered). I was hoping it would arrive fast and fit. Right, huh? Well . . not only did the shoes arrive as I expected, they fit! My husband loves them and has worn them pretty steadily for 1.5 years now. They have been wonderful! He has not complained of plantar fascitis, and that is amazing. I love these shoes and I'm buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: UTblue

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are not as nice and sturdy as they use to be
customer_reviews.text: The rigid velcro part is separating from the shoe strap. The strap is beginning to stretch and is not strong enough, getting weaker. These shoes are not as nice and sturdy as they use to be. Are you getting them from a legit seller? They are not the same quality that Propet use to make. I have gotten these shoes for my husband for many years. I hate to say it but I know the velcro strap is going to give on him. They were not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: LIZ

customer_reviews.title: Shoe tongue disintegrates!!!
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of use, shoe tongue disintegrated on both shoes!!!! Have bought these in the past without this type of failure.
customer_reviews.author: kapzy

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe with a big problem.
customer_reviews.text: I generally like to use a product before rating it. I've had these shoes for about 18 months as of this writing, so this isn't a snap judgement. I like these shoes as much or more than any others in this category. The problem is that I, like many others, have experienced the Velcro on the straps separating from the leather. The stitching doesn't hold, and eventually, the two separate entirely. This is distinctly inferior workmanship on an otherwise fine product, but until/unless Propet acknowledges and addresses this problem, I cannot recommend these to anyone. Too bad, too. It's an otherwise nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: best shoes for comfort
customer_reviews.text: It is getting hard find leather walking shoes that are this comfortable. I just got these black shoes because I have a pair of the tan and I wear them everywhere. Some times when I get up in the morning I put these on instead of my slippers because of ankle pain. if you are over 70yrs old you will love these as much as the youngsters.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: fairly decent product
customer_reviews.text: I read a LOT of the reviews, and felt that the normal width would be fine. I was wrong! I take a 10.5, wide, normally, but have found that the more recently produced crop of sports shoes require ordering the next size up, and some don't even offer 1/2 sizes. This shoe is TIGHT in the toe box even in my bare feet; with socks it just would NEVER be comfortable. Added to that, the very front of the shoe looks to be of minimal construction, not at all as robust as my last pair of New Balance, which I was looking to replace with this, supposedly BETTER, shoe. Guess this will be another return, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: ChazW

customer_reviews.title: Good if I could get the color I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Three stars only because the pair Amazon sent me was white, not the sport white (i.e. light tan) I had ordered. I returned the white ones for a refund. These were to replace the sport white ones I currently own which initially were very comfortable but the tradeoff is their soft insole compresses over time so the comfort doesn't last forever. I have had similar experiences with other shoes with soft or memory foam insoles. These Propets did last longer than the others. You need to decide if the tradeoff is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PTM

customer_reviews.title: Supportive
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 91 year old brother in law. Obviously the velcro helps people who have lost some of their dexterity in their fingers, but this has the full strap with velcro, so it holds well and can be looser or lighter based on the foot width. His other pair of Dr, schools the velcro was only on half the length and didn't hold very well. They are more supportive to his ankles, and this helps keep him from having his ankle collapse and him fall. The tread on the bottom also seems very grippy. He says they are comfortable. When someone is housebound, having a good fitting shoe is very comforting both both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Geisha Girl

customer_reviews.title: Asian US sizes are much smaller than German US sizes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these 9 5E US sneakers to replace some Puma 9 3E sneakers that are starting to wear out. I expected something easy to slip on, easy to fasten, comfortable for my feet, something I could wear for more than an hour. Nope. None of that. The sneakers are obviously narrower than 3E. I'd say they are just standard width. The tongue label says 3E but if you could see them, you'd know what a joke that is. If you are going to spend this much money trying to get something that is honestly what you are looking for, don't go to Propet.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Barnes

customer_reviews.title: they stretched a great deal extremely quickly
customer_reviews.text: When they arrived the shoes fit as you would normally expect shoes of the proper size to fit. However, they stretched a great deal extremely quickly, and after having the only eight months three out of the four Velcro straps do not hold down very well and the fourth one will not hold at all. I am in a wheelchair and do not even walk on the shoes they receive virtually no wear and yet after such a short time the Velcro straps have failed. I recommend getting something else, that's what I did.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Gianferante

customer_reviews.title: What's happened to Propet quality?
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Propet for years. The last few pairs no matter the style have worn prematurely and lasted maybe 2-4 months. this pair was the absolute worst. They have been worn 5 times. The sole started compressing flat on the first wear and no longer stands up. The bottom of the sole has started peeling back from the toe of the shoe. Fix your quality issues Propet please. There are many people with medical conditions who rely on your shoes. thank goodness for Amazon's return policy or I'd be stuck with these defective shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Shantylivin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable; handy velcro closure; details done right!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second pair of these shoes, so I'll have a pair in reserve when the first pair wears out. I bought the first pair a couple of weeks ago, and they are very comfortable. I bought them to replace a pair of cheap New Balance walking shoes that were uncomfortable, squeaky, and disappointing. These Propét shoes felt good when I first put them on, and they have become even more comfortable after a week of wearing them. They are not too tight anywhere, and there is plenty of room in the toes. The straps are the right length and width, and the velcro is well done. I like them very much.
customer_reviews.author: The Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Second pair for my husband!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a diabetic and foot care for diabetics is of utmost importance, this will be the second pair in as many years. I get him 1/2 size up in a wide width to make sure of enough room in the toe box. Also this way he can wear extra cushy sox! He really likes his Propets, especially now with the strap. Has worn them every day, feels they are very comfortable. Just hope Propet does not change these! Sometimes one finds a great shoe and just when you get to like them somebody goes and changes them! Please: If it works, don’t fix it!!
customer_reviews.author: SpyderwomanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Propet comes through again
customer_reviews.text: I have owned about five pairs of Propet shoes, including three pairs of these Life Walking shoes. I'm 67-years old and I like moderate walks with the dog. I also prefer these shoes to slippers around the house! They are constructed with just the right amount of arch support, but not too much. There is adequate toe room and they are flexible, meaning the leather on the outside is not stiff. You can wear them comfortably right out of the box. Clearly, these are my favorite "go to" shoes for every day wear. And no foot pain whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Macburger52

customer_reviews.title: Happy, happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: Such an improvement! Does the rest of the world know about these shoes. I have some foot problem, achy, swelling, and was mostly wearing sandal. My doctor said to get a real pair of shoes. I've nominated him for a Nobel in Medicine... Such an improvement. The arch support is very good. The "plus 2" US sizes is a little daunting, but the sizing chart really helps. They are a little wider than I expected but still very comfortable and will come in handy of my feet swell up again. (I sound like such an old man.) By these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zarowitz

customer_reviews.title: Lifewalkers by Propet are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn these sneakers for years. I also wear the women's model. We find them very comfortable, endurable, easy to clean, and a perfect fit. The cushioned foot is very comfortable when walking long or short distances. The men's version has straps that hold the shoe closed. The women's has either ties or straps.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Why do I buy these shoes?
customer_reviews.text: Once upon a time, I got the loops of my laces caught on my break peddle and I almost crashed my car. I thought about those kids every morning waiting for the school bus and decided I'd never wear laces again. I know that Velcro is usually thought to be for old people who have arthritis and can't tie their shoes anymore, but I don't care. It was a freak occurrence, but it happened none the less. Think about it. Maybe it never happens to you, but it happened to me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for sensitive feet.
customer_reviews.text: We are disappointed with the tongue in this sneaker. It is way too narrow for the shoe's proportions as an Extra extra-Wide width. The shoe tongue does not tuck well at the sides. It's annoying. However, the rest of the sneaker is fine, so my husband will keep them. They are light in weight, comfy and like his other, dressier Propet shoe. Nice smooth seams inside the shoe. On the extra wide sizes, the tongue needs to be wider and the Velcro straps not so short across the tongue. His Scandia dressier shoe is proportioned much better and is extra extra-wide as ordered.
customer_reviews.author: J Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent workmanship, top quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent workmanship, top quality. This is my 2nd order of this model Propet LIfe Walker. 1st is 3 years old. shows very little wear. Just as comfortable as when new. Excellent slip resistance on slippery floors. I am very Senior citizen. If I ever need another sneaker, will very clearly be Propet. NOTE: I also have a pair of Propet velcro close shoes. Also 3 years old. Look & feel like new. Highly recommended. NOTE: On this new pair - had a delivery error by AMAZON. Corrected within an hour of delivery. Absolute FIRST CLASS SERVICE.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Denkert

customer_reviews.title: Avoid:  Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Ultra-thin. Very little padding on the sole. I am sorry I bought these. Compared to the New Balance walkers, these are a serious step down, and there's not much difference in price. Why did I buy them? The name. Unfortunately, this shoe does not meet even a minimal standard.
customer_reviews.author: Lili Hrabchak

customer_reviews.title: Only shoes that worked for severe edema.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband who has severe edema. The wide opening meant he could get these shoes on with a little wiggling. Once on, they can be easily adjusted to the differences in each foot. He has worn them for several days and we really appreciate how solid they feel as he walks with his canes. After just a few days we ordered a second pair from this company but in a different style.
customer_reviews.author: English Bob

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for diabetic feet!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe saved my life! I had actually pondered the possibility of missing my daughter's wedding. But THIS shoe... this 'cloud of comfort', allowed me to spend the entire wedding weekend for her wedding. I was actually able to 'walk her down the aisle' without wincing in foot pain! And my 'father's dance with the bride'... was the epitome of my experience! THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: Fits Well Enough
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up as something as a gamble, and I'm still not sure if I can recommend it, but I'm also not sure it's the company's fault. I picked these up under "diabetic shoes" and due to my edema, one of my feet is more swollen than the other, so I'm not sure I'm ever going to find something that's a good fit for me. I just figured, otherwise I'll spend half as much money at Walmart for something that's going to fall apart in three months.
customer_reviews.author: James Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for very wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with very wide, flat feet, so buying shoes that fit comfortably is a struggle. These shoes fit me so well, it's as though the designer had molds of my feet to work with. I started with a white pair and just ordered black.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah in SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The advertizement mentioned the shoe as being leather. I don't know what kind it is, or if it is real leather. There is basically no arch support. I added insoles so the shoes were comfortable. I use this shoe for a lot of walking and exercising at the gym. After using the shoe for about three weeks, the shoe is terrible. I bought the shoes for the straps. rather than laces. that is the only good thing about them. Would never buy again!!! jgb .
customer_reviews.author: jerry g bair

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes for aging feet.
customer_reviews.text: These shows differ from the normal shoes I've worn all my adult life, but aging feet -- cramped toes, pinched toe nails, aching arches -- love these shoes. Easy to put on and take off, comfortable for walking and standing, eliminates pain from cramped toe nails and sagging arches. This is my second pair, and will be my go to shoe for every day wear. There are other, less expensive velcro shoes (~ $30) which I use for yard work, but these are a bit better for business casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Wide not really wide and velcro too short.
customer_reviews.text: Well... I bought these based on a lot of good reviews, but I have to be honest - I really don't like these. I ordered a 15 extra (extra) wide as I have foot issues, and these were no wider than standard Xtra wide shoes I've had. They pinched in several areas and were uncomfortable. Also the top strap of velcro is FAR too short, as if you have a wide top-foot area and need to spread it open just a bit, there's not enough velcro to stretch over to the other side. Needs at least 2 more inches of it, especially in the top strap area. I have to return. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Have had these shoes for several months now and am really disappointed. They are not nearly as comfortable as New Balance. The leather is much stiffer (cheap), they are heavy and starting to show unusual wear. The leather on the inside top of the heel is crumbling and coming off! Have not worn these shoes on a regular basis as they just aren't as comfortable as I had hoped. Will stick with New Balance in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DAD LOVES THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.text: My dads feet are very swollen. His shoes weren't comfortable at all. i decided to see if Amazon had anything to help. I brought these shoes to him and he wears them all the time now. Not only the fact they are comfortable they also look very nice on.. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: country girl

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy a similar looking shoe at Payless for about $25.00. Then I found a pair of these at a thrift shop and I liked them better. Once it was time for a new pair I researched where to get them and found them here on Amazon. Although they are more expensive than what I used to buy, they are more comfortable and much more durable. The ones I used to buy would be wearing out after 3 months, whereas these will last me a year. I am tough on shoes and these are definitely worth the higher cost because they last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good footwear for aging diabetics!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit, I like the cushioning and comfort, I like the construction, I like the reasonable price, I like the convenience of the velcro straps. This is the third pair of these shoes I've bought, and I see no reason to switch to something else. Admittedly it doesn't have a pretty swoosh on the side -- that's just a cross I'll have to bear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a very wide foot and Propet is the only brand of sneaker he finds comfortable. Due to some health issues, the Velcro strap is easier for him to use. I have ordered a second pair so he can change off and not wear the same pair till worn out! Excellent product and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for diabetics.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pushing 70 and walk about 6 miles a day in the hot tropical sun on concrete surfaces. These shoes are great. I would, however, recommend buying decent insoles. The Velcro straps are an added plus. Also, they are highly recommended for diabetics, which is basically why I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Stryffeler

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, when the box arrived at my door, thought it was empty. Didn't expect these shoes to be so light and that's a plus. By far, the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn right out of the box. I know, look a bit geeky with the velcro straps but I'm an old man who just doesn't care and need comfort and easy off and on.
customer_reviews.author: zfdtruckman

customer_reviews.title: Fit very well and look durable
customer_reviews.text: I have the issue this shoe was meant to address, some numbness and pain in the feet, with a bit of swelling. Makes walking a chore, especially in the morning or after sitting for a while. I have been pleasantly surprised with these, now my feet hurt less, maybe they will gradually get better. It takes a bit to get them broken in, this is still happening. Easy to put on, and the straps make the shoe vary as needed in width and tightness around the ankles. Soles are quite thick and seems like would last a good long time and protects the sensitive bottoms of the feet from stepping on something that your feet would not like.
customer_reviews.author: Moraine Lake

customer_reviews.title: Fits Well for my Fat Piggies!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two this time! IF the shoe fits, wear it! No truer words have been spoken! ( may need an innersole for more support) UPDATE: These shoes are the first shoes in existence that I can just put on and not deal with 2 weeks of painful break in period!! I cannot say enough about them....I always reorder each year. They last about 12-16 months. then I need a new pare because the soles ware unevenly for me..
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Curran

customer_reviews.title: Strong side wall support,non-slip soles and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe gives my feet a feeling of strong side support. Also, the combination of the non-skid sole and the comfort of the inner and outer materials allows me to feel safe and in comfort while walking. The Velcro straps are ruggedly strong and big enough to allow me to easily put my shoes on snugly.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Z

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Shoe Value!
customer_reviews.text: When I received these, I pulled off my old shoes and put these on thinking I would need to 'wear them in' for a few days, an hour or so at a time, before I wore them for my 8-hour shifts... I was WRONG! They felt perfectly comfortable from the minute I tightened up the convenient Velcro straps! I could wear these to sleep! Get 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Brion Bell

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good looking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 92-year-old father. He was walking on the insteps of his shoes, shuffling along like a hobo. These shoes look very nice, fit well, and support his feet. He really needs the velcro straps, and I was so glad to find a decent looking shoe with an accessible strap. I believe these shoes will last him for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Molchan/Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Amazon lags way behind
customer_reviews.text: Tried this xpensive shoe after finding the diabetes rating and utterly lags behind. It does not feel like arch support any better than regular shoe. Felt like walking on ground without a support after first use. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay kumar

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I am never dissappointed by buying Propet products, and this walking shoe exceeded my expectations. My husband is diabetic so we realize the importance of well fitting shoes. These are actually very reasonable for being shoes approved for diabetics. He had to purchase a 5 E to accommodate compression wrappings, but the shoes fit fine even over the wrappings and don't look like huge "boats" on his feet. They give a very stylish, fitted look even at a 5E size. Not sure how they manage that, but these are so much better than a pair of walkers he had in the past that looked like Frankinstein's shoes! Great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gumbo148

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for work. Our offices are distributed between three buildings in an office park and some days I have to walk several times between all three buildings. These are extremely comfortable and very easy to put on because of the Velcro straps.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Easy on and off as long as you don’t have swollen feet. We ordered one sizes up because they run small, and if you have issues with swollen feet, make sure to order a larger size. The Velcro really helps.
customer_reviews.author: EvE313

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes.....Work well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. Will by more. Why "no" on arch support? Because there hasn't been a pair of shoes I could wear that didn't need my old Dr. Scholls leather arch supports with the steel built in. Remember those? You can't buy them anymore. These shoes are MUCH better than anything I could find at the big box stores and most of the smaller chains either don't carry them or they are way overpriced. I have never purchased shoes online but my wife said she has many times. One thing she noticed was that there was no paperwork for returning them in the box if they didn't fit. Hmm. We will see...but so far they fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdtimer

customer_reviews.title: Propet Men's Walker is a great value
customer_reviews.text: The shoes seems to run about a 1/2 to1 size small. I increased the length and width 1 size up from my normal size and they fit and feel great. They are well worth the purchase price. I stopped buying New Balance about 3 years ago because the straps were shortened. I still have a brand new pair of them that I can't wear.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M. Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased this product line before and have been quite satisfied. I’ m A diabetic I require backups
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this product line before and have been quite satisfied . I’ m A diabetic I require backups . That’s three sneakers. , three Sunday go to meetings types and three causal ware . I have to throw them out for the least ware . I have to ware thicker socks and watch for the least redness on my feet . The 5 E is a must !
customer_reviews.author: Nelson A Hill

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected.
customer_reviews.text: These Propet walkers are just what I needed, as I walk on a concrete warehouse floor all day from one end to the other (about the length of a football field). They are very comfortable, price is reasonable, and I feel like I will be able to get many miles out of them. Definitely one of my better buys.
customer_reviews.author: Dean S.

customer_reviews.title: well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have tried New Balance, and other name-brand marketers of wide walking shoes. No help at all for my feet. The Propet shoe line, has consistently produced a shoe that eases the discomfort of wide feet. The toe is wide, and the shoe does not constrict. The strap-tie is perfect for these old hands and I now have the brown, black and white models.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my elderly father just by going by his unusual size and what his other shoes looked like. He didn't know what to think upon seeing them, as he really didn't think he was going to like them. After he wore them for a couple of days, he told me how much more he liked them than the other pair of shoes he had been using. I had ordered him 2 pair because his size is so hard to find. He now thanks me so much for getting him these shoes! Great Shoe for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Joan R.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: “It came in a cream color (I thought I ordered white). I kept them irregardless because I was anxious for shoes I could put on by myself because of my fractured patella. But I don’t really like the way they look.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for people with foot problems
customer_reviews.text: These shoes a third the price that I have paid for similar shoes and podiatrist likes them after I bought the first pair I bought a second pair and haveTold other friends about them I don't have to pay over 150.00 again for such great she's and with my orthotics I am walking better.
customer_reviews.author: James Townsend Darragh

customer_reviews.title: Shoe Review
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was immediately sent back. Ordered for my father with hammertoe condition. Was not big enough in toe box and width was too narrow. Shoe looked well made, just way too small. Disappointed since it was supposed to have alot of width and room for my fathers condition. Didn't seem much different than a normal pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: More a D width .....not a 5E width
customer_reviews.text: Product is supposed to be 5E wide. I always buy 13 5E or 6E in other brands with no problem. I couldn't fit in these shoes at all. This fit more like a D. It also looked used since it was dirty on the inner sole. I returned it the day after it arrived. Very disappointed in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Best Walking Sneaker Ever
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are outstanding. Perfect fit and for the first time in a long time and I didn't have to break them in. A well made and designed shoe. I wear a size 13 3E and these sneakers are really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RAB-213

customer_reviews.title: Almost A Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like many things about this shoe, it is comfortable, the fit is very good, the style is good, the toe is especially nice. The shoe is not heavy and the Velcro closure is convenient. On the other hand, the finish is quite dull, more dull than the picture on the Amazon web page. I didn't expect it to shine like a dress shoe but I prefer the finish of my (also black) New Balance 608's. If I drag my feet even slightly on our tile floor these shoes shriek, much like the sound of a smoke detector with a low battery. I don't remember another shoe doing this and I find it quite disconcerting.
customer_reviews.author: edcaroleg

customer_reviews.title: Need better consistency in sizes between diff models
customer_reviews.text: No consistency with this brand. Mistakenly bought this shoe thinking it was the vista walker I bought previously. Bought both in size 15 5e wide. These were too narrow whereas the vista walker were nice and wide especially in the toe box. Need the extra width as a diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyDeuce

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for leather walking shoes because my NewBalance walkers were made o painted cloth and the paint would bubble up and peal off with in two months. I have been wearing the Propets for a couple months and they still look great and keep getting more comfortable as I wear them. I wear a size 13w and these fit perfectly
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: They fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have large and wide feet and have been having trouble finding shoes that fit. I bought $175 Drew shoes that were the same width size but a little too tight for me. I tried the Propet and they feel and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Brummond

customer_reviews.title: This brand just runs narrow!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 D. •Ordered a pair in that size >> WAAY to narrow. •Re-ordered in 12 W >> STILL a pinch too narrow but next size up would certainly be too wide. Be forewarned. JUST rec'd them, don't know how they'll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: RobWms

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Straps and Truly Wide Width
customer_reviews.text: 1) We couldn't find Velcro strapped sneakers anywhere in town. We were told not enough people bought them to warrant keeping on the shelf. I'm so glad we found them on line. 2) You know how some wide width shoes aren't really? Not these, the dimensions are exactly what they say are. If you have wide width feet, get these shoes. Very sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: TheresaNull

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet and have a difficult time finding shoes that fit. Bought a pair of these about a year ago in beige (they look like old man shoes but they fit and were half the price of the black at the time[I'm cheap!]). Was skeptical about mail-order shoes since good fitting ones are so hard to find but the fit was perfect. I use the old ones around the house, cutting grass, etc. The black ones do look a little more presentable so I wear them in public. Of course I can't guarantee the fit on any one else but for me, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C. Pursel

customer_reviews.title: He really likes it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my 90 year old father who insisted on wearing a pair of dirty. worn, laced walking shoes (an embarrassment to take him to a restaurant) rather than the assortment of other alternatives I had bought and had to return. These he likes and has not told me to return. He likes the fit, the easy double Velcro closures and the off-white color. Miracle of miracles! Besides this they arrived wonderfully packed and seem to be of excellent quality. A real find and priced really well! I hope that by the next visit those old disgusting shoes are gone or at the least relegated to the back of his closet floor.
customer_reviews.author: wblobsta

customer_reviews.title: Not EEE W
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is okay, but no way is this EEE Wide. Two of us tried it on and both found it very narrow at front. It looks narrow compared to single E wide shows I already own.
customer_reviews.author: Hampsteader

customer_reviews.title: Pedal Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The Rockports we ordered prior did not fit as expected, returned. We needed a true extra wide width and I knew these ran wide. A reviewer suggested to pay the additional 15 dollars and get this model. I am so glad I did, he loves them. With arthritis and a big bunion it is hard to find shoes wide enough, soft enough not to hurt. The leather is supple and the shoes are deep enough to accommodate his orthotic. Good quality, good looking Velcro strap shoe. I even ordered another pair to keep on hand for dressier occasions. I know they will be worn.
customer_reviews.author: Pet  Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he said they are very comfortable. Great price! Last year I paid more for different brand that turned out not to be that great for his feet.
customer_reviews.author: Angelwalker

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and offer really good support
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband; he loves them and can walk all day breaking them in for an up-coming trip. They are very comfortable and offer really good support. Would definitely recommend these walking shoes and they look very nice on the foot. Not at all like a sport shoe which can look sloppy-ish, so to speak.
customer_reviews.author: Gerimack

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a nice shoe, somewhat light, good looking and well made. I ordered a 10 5E for a man with swollen legs and feet. His normal size is 8.5 3E. He has a pair of Hush Puppies 9.5 wide that he wares all the time. The tag said this was a 10 EEEEE but he couldn't get into it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ayjude

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 85 and has been on his feet most of his working life. He has a very high arch on the top of his foot, which makes for a hard fit. He also wears a 13,but a 14 is better--a 131/2 would really be good. I am always cautious when ordering a new brand, but he is very pleased with these, and so am I because he is happy Thanks for your swift action and great service. I like that you ask me how pleased with the product ordered I am. thanks, Joann Barry
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for a deserving WWII veteran
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers were purchased by our American Legion Post as a gift to one of our WWII vets who was having trouble keeping the laces on his sneakers tied. We were concerned he might trip and fall, injuring himself so we purchased these sneakers with the velcro closures. They are perfect and he loves them, says they are very comfortable and we can rest easy knowing he won't trip on an untied shoelace.
customer_reviews.author: JT Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A shoe that has not been changed and made shorter on the sides to save money. This shoe actually fits, and the straps go across the top and close securely. My husband says these are very comfortable. So I bought two more pair to keep in the closet for when he needs more! The last shoes we bought for him had changed how they were made and no longer fit; they were shorter on the side, and the straps no longer closed securely. These are great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Repeated purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the shoe my husband wears. This is his third pair. Prophet fits him perfectly and holds up better than some other brands he’s had.
customer_reviews.author: 6639KCE

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, feels great.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a lot of knee pain and sometimes heel pain. He usually does not like new shoes. He put these on and immediately said he liked them because they felt great.
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes very comfortable uppers they are lighter weight than ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes very comfortable uppers they are lighter weight than expected the soles are thin enough to feel uneven surfaces while walking. I will add good insoles for support and additional comfort I still think they might make me happy as things come together.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn miotke

customer_reviews.title: Geat shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are very light and require no breaking in, I wore them to the gym the morning after they arrived with no issues, totally comfortable. I have three different pairs of Propets, two pair of shoes with velcro closure and a water proof boot that sips up over the instep, I love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Reader in the rain

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for walking long distance.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, fits great, durable. Since having gastric bypass, I'm walking several miles a day. Makes walking fun, feet don't sweat or hurt after 6 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Allen M Burke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the most comfortable shoe that I have owned in years. Unlike most new shoes, within less than 15 minutes I hardly noticed that they were on my feet. They are that comfortable. Thou a bit pricey, I would buy again for the shear comfort.
customer_reviews.author: M Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe
customer_reviews.text: It has been very hard to find this type of shoe and I am glad to have found one. It is comfortable and easy to put one and take off at my young age.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: Propet Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe. Recommend getting wider than you think is needed. I have wide feet and ordered E width, but still a little tight. I have used Propet brand before and they seem to last well. They are replacing Everlast shoes that never fit well and sure did not wear well and were a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several brands of shoes and something was not quite right with each. This pair was right as soon as I put them on! Can't go wrong with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable? Shoe 'nuff!
customer_reviews.text: In white, the PROPET LIFE WALKER SNEAKER is a sharp-looking piece of footwear. They're easy on-or-off, and remain comfy even after hours of use. AMMY's size chart for these is quite accurate. SUGGESTION: if half-sizes are available in your range, go for a half-size larger, then wear extra-thick socks. The result is a luxurious treat for the feet. PROPET velcro strap walkers for men or women get my highest recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Van Auken

customer_reviews.title: I just loosen them up some and my feet don't feel cramped like they would if I had them cinched up for ...
customer_reviews.text: The only 5Es I could find, including New Balance. Velcro straps are the only way to go for several reasons, laces are toast. If I'm not walking in them, I just loosen them up some and my feet don't feel cramped like they would if I had them cinched up for walking/running--which is true for all shoes. They look nice except for the cheesy satin over-the-tongue labels. I clipped the stitches on them and those bad boys were history in a couple of minutes. The other subdued logos look nice.
customer_reviews.author: The Paineful Truth

customer_reviews.title: Fit very well and easy on the feet
customer_reviews.text: Now that I am retired and don't have to wear dress shoes much, I was looking for a pair of soft "walkaround" shoes I could wear all the time and do yardwork also. These shoes fit the bill. They are very comfortable. The only downside is that if you wear them every day, like I do, they wear out within a year or so. The heels and soles are fairly soft and the wear is primarily on the heels and the toe area. I would definitely recommend them for casual use.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Franz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Shoes
customer_reviews.text: His feet is too swollen to get the shoes on Shoes needs to be much wilder for Lipidemia patient
customer_reviews.author: Loretta S.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: My husband works on his feet all day. These are his new go to shoes. Very nice quality and comfortable. I bought a pair and love them for exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Sher Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Quality of Construction
customer_reviews.text: Too Early to tell.The construction looks tight and even and solid. I wanted a sole and heel pattern that would not collect a lot of dirt and debris and that's what I got.I also like the solid rubber one piece sole and heel.It's nice and firm and should stand up much better than a spongy one.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT FIT & FABRICATION, FEATHER-LIGHT,
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews & was a little nervous about the fit -- NO NEED -- EXCELLENT FIT (I'm a 14EEE). The shoe IS very light-weight on the foot... the Velcro is JUST THE RIGHT length -- no "overlap" -- holds the shoes securely in place. I have balance problems, but these shoes really help me on my feet. The Fabrication is excellent -- very durable -- so DON'T PAY ATTENTION to other reviews here. THIS IS THE SHOE FOR YOU if you need a light-weight but durable shoe that you can pop on & off -- no cumbersome laces -- and keep yourself going. VERY GLAD THAT I ORDERED THIS SHOE.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: The size in length runs as expected, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: The size in length runs as expected, but the width is a tad smaller than I expected. Of course, I swapped the original insole with my own orthotics insoles, and that may be why the width seemed a bit tight. I ordered the same size but in a wide shoe, and the width was much too wide. So, I decided to keep the original pair with the expectation that adjusting the closure will help to compensate for the lack of extra width. By adjusting the Velcro straps the she really does fit okay.
customer_reviews.author: greenflea

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes, nice and wide, no pressure on my bone-spurs After I ordered/added a good arch support Insole they were perfect (Musing arch support is the only reason they got 4 stars instead of 5) Got lots of compliments on them at work (hospital)
customer_reviews.author: Christine Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Light weight is big deal to seniors
customer_reviews.text: Hubbs says best feature is weight of sneaks. He first said they were ugly, but I knew he thought it was too much money. Hubbs said, "they're so light I'm not as tired after walking here & there." He's easy to please, thinks everything costs too much money these days, so had to buy these for him. He's glad I did ;)
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Josleyn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes that are good for 300 miles
customer_reviews.text: What I like most is that I can remove the insole and replace it with my custom insoles that improve comfort and pain in my own body. I walk several miles each day and these shoes wear well and give me 250-300 miles before wearing out the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Davidson

customer_reviews.title: and literally painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: Over a decade ago, I went through several successive pairs of Propet's "1000 Mile" walking shoes. They fit perfectly and were so long lasting as to be virtually indestructible. This is not that shoe. It's tight through the midfoot but loose in the heelcup, stiff, and literally painful to wear. I'm hoping it improves with a little breakin time, but I was in actual pain after a day spent in these shoes. And I work sitting down!
customer_reviews.author: T. Plumb

customer_reviews.title: These shoes were poorly made and I wouldn't buy them ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were poorly made and I wouldn't buy them. In fact, I returned them and bought Dr. Comfort instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK for a while, but wished they ahd lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of velcro walking shoes. These were ok for a couple of months. I usually get 6 months (or longer) from my walking shoes. I walk about an hour a day in addition to wearing the shoes whenever I'm out. The velcro sticking on these seems to have had it (about 4 months) and the cushioning is finished as the shoes are really uncomfortable after about 20 minutes into my daily walk. So, I've had to "retire" these shoes earlier than I have done with other brands (Reebok, New Balance).
customer_reviews.author: Mid South Bob

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my dad and his second pair. Comfortable and easy to put on. Provides good traction on what could be slippery floors.
customer_reviews.author: Paula O'Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Light weight sneaker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I especially appreciate their lightness. I wear them in excercise class. My "old pair" I now use in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur R. Stees

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, very comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing Propets for over thirty years. They are very comfortable with a good wife for box. You can't go wrong with Propets!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro close is outstanding when compared to shoe strings.
customer_reviews.author: carter e wilson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT leather sneakers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who is very picky about what he wants. He wanted to replacce a pair he'd had for about five years but couldn't find what h wanted in local stores. I started looking and the only ones that fit his criteria and still were under $100 were these. H was skeptical about buying online but I told him to try and if they didn't fit or weren't what he wanted, we could return them. Mr Picky loves them! He's worn them for about a month now, every day. He takes the dogs for 3-4 walks each day, and wears them everywhere except in the gardenand aroud the house (when he doesn't wear any shoes).
customer_reviews.author: Page Scandrol

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my father. He has had back surgery and a hip replacement. He says these are the best shoes he has ever had. Super comfortable and that it "feels like walking on pillows"
customer_reviews.author: hschad

product_meta.title: Propét Men's Life Walker Footwear
product_meta.description: Propet Men's Life Walker Strap W - FOOTWEAR||MEN'S FOOTWEAR||MEN'S WALKING
feature_bullets: Padded collar and tongue. Built in contoured heel stabilizer with dual strap velcro closure
EVA midsole with durable arch support
